comment: A comprehensive, curated list of stampede-prone locations and historical incidents in India, based on provided data.

risk_factors.known_bottlenecks: Bathing ghats (Sangam), pontoon bridges, and connecting railway stations.
risk_factors.common_triggers: Massive crowds on auspicious days ('Shahi Snan'), pilgrims rushing for trains post-event, general crowd control failures.
risk_factors.terrain_issues: Temporary structures can fail; massive, open, unstructured areas.

historical_incidents.cause: Pilgrims jostling for space during holy dip.
Stampede at Allahabad railway station as pilgrims departed.
Failure of crowd control measures.
Historical incident, details sparse.
Historical incident, details sparse.

risk_factors.common_triggers: Heavy rush of devotees on bathing days.

historical_incidents.cause: Stampede at Har-ki-Pauri ghat.
Stampede during Kumbh Mela.
Historical incident, details sparse.
Historical incident, details sparse.

risk_factors.common_triggers: Post-match celebrations, attempts at forcible entry, ticket queues.

historical_incidents.cause: Fans attempting forcible entry during IPL victory celebration.

risk_factors.known_bottlenecks: Narrow forest paths (e.g., Pulmedu), main temple complex.
risk_factors.common_triggers: Heavy rush during Mandala-Makaravilakku season, vehicle accidents on pilgrim routes.

historical_incidents.cause: Jeep crashed into pilgrims, causing panic on a narrow path.
Crowd crush.

risk_factors.known_bottlenecks: Bridge over the Sindh river leading to the temple.
risk_factors.common_triggers: Rumors of bridge collapse during Navratri.
risk_factors.terrain_issues: Reliance on a single bridge for access.

historical_incidents.cause: Panic triggered by rumor of bridge collapse.
Previous stampede incident.

risk_factors.terrain_issues: Steep steps made slippery by offerings (coconuts).

historical_incidents.cause: People falling on slippery steps, causing a pile-up.

risk_factors.known_bottlenecks: Narrow path leading to the temple.
risk_factors.common_triggers: Rumors of a bomb during Navratri festival.

historical_incidents.cause: Stampede triggered by rumors of a bomb.
Stampede triggered by rumors of a rockslide.
Historical incident.

risk_factors.common_triggers: Preacher departing, causing a surge of devotees.
risk_factors.terrain_issues: Open fields with poor crowd control infrastructure.

historical_incidents.cause: Surge of devotees rushing towards the preacher's convoy.

risk_factors.known_bottlenecks: Gate No. 3, narrow paths to sanctum.
risk_factors.common_triggers: Heavy rush on special days (New Year's), arguments between pilgrims.

historical_incidents.cause: Stampede triggered by heavy rush and altercation.

risk_factors.common_triggers: Sudden rain, peak hour rush, rumors.

historical_incidents.cause: Overcrowding on narrow bridge during rain.

risk_factors.terrain_issues: Large, open space that can be poorly lit.

historical_incidents.cause: Stampede after Dussehra celebrations.

risk_factors.common_triggers: Rush for free food and clothes.

historical_incidents.cause: Stampede during a distribution of free items.

risk_factors.common_triggers: Huge crowd on opening day of festival.

historical_incidents.cause: Stampede at a major bathing spot during Pushkaram festival.

risk_factors.common_triggers: Heavy rush of passengers during festival seasons (e.g., Kumbh Mela).

historical_incidents.cause: Stampede as Maha Kumbh pilgrims rushed to catch trains.
